channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: U.S. economy grew at a 2.8% pace in the second quarter, much more than expected
item.description: Gross domestic product in the second quarter was expected to show a 2.1% annualized increase.

item.title: OpenAI announces a search engine called SearchGPT; Alphabet shares dip
item.description: OpenAI announced a prototype of its SearchGPT search engine on Thursday.

item.title: Wegovy rival to be part of a suite of weight loss drugs, Roche CEO says following positive trial results
item.description: Roche said Thursday that its Wegovy rival weight loss drugs will be part of a suite of medicines aimed at combatting the effects of obesity.

item.title: Ford shares post worst day since 2008, leading autos rout after company's disappointing earnings
item.description: Ford closed Thursday at $11.16, down by 18.4% — marking the stock's worst daily decline since 2008 and the second-worst performer of S&P 500 companies.

item.title: Revolut clinches UK banking license, ending three-year wait
item.description: British fintech startup Revolut on Thursday that it had received a preliminary banking license with restrictions, bringing to an end a three-year wait.

item.title: Lineage closes up more than 3% in market’s largest IPO of 2024
item.description: Lineage, the largest temperature-controlled warehouse REIT in the world, closed up by more than 3% after going public under the ticker symbol "LINE."

item.title: $1 million hypothetical portfolios: How kids from wealthy families at an elite Swiss school learn about money
item.description: Bernhard Gademann, president of an elite Swiss boarding school, has a strategy to cater to the children of parents who pay more than $160,000 in tuition a year.

item.title: How the ultra-wealthy travel in Paris
item.description: CNBC Travel's First Class explores the top places to stay, eat and spend your time in Paris —with an unlimited budget.

item.title: Philippines battles to contain oil spill as tanker sinks, leaving one dead
item.description: A tanker carrying 1.4 million liters of industrial fuel sank off the coast of Philippines, leading to one casualty and a vast oil spill.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The tax with potential side effects
item.description: The Indian government is borrowing a page from 17th-century England over taxation, but modern Britain holds the clue to some of its side effects.

item.title: Coinbase UK unit fined $4.5 million by British regulator over 'high-risk' customer breaches
item.description: U.K. regulators fined Coinbase's U.K. arm £3.5 million ($4.5 million) on Thursday over breaches of a voluntary agreement designed to stop the cryptocurrency exchange onboarding "high-risk customers.

item.title: China to use ultra-long bonds for consumer, trade-in policy support as worries about retail sales slump grow
item.description: China on Thursday announced its most targeted measures yet for boosting consumption, which has remained lackluster since the pandemic.

item.title: 'Deadpool & Wolverine' set for highest opening of an R-rated film
item.description: Disney and Marvel's "Deadpool & Wolverine" is expected to shatter box office records and become the highest opening film with an R-rating.

item.title: Shares of Gucci-owner Kering hit seven-year low after weak forecast, revenue drop on low China sales
item.description: Shares in Gucci-owner Kering fell on Thursday after the luxury group announced a sharp decline in revenue in the first half of the year.

item.title: Southwest profit falls 46% as airline takes 'urgent' steps to increase revenue
item.description: Southwest is under pressure from an activist investor after it lagged competitors.

item.title: Unilever pops 6% on margin guidance raise, Ben & Jerry's spinoff on track to complete by end of 2025
item.description: The company, whose vast portfolio of brands spans Dove, Axe, Knorr and Vaseline, recorded sales growth across all segments in the first half of the year.

item.title: Jeep, Dodge maker Stellantis reports 48% drop in first-half net profit on weak U.S. sales
item.description: Auto giant Stellantis on Thursday reported a steep drop in first-half net profit, citing reduced volumes and lower market share in North America.

item.title: India is on alert after a fresh outbreak of the deadly Nipah virus. Here’s what you need to know
item.description: Health authorities in the southern Indian state of Kerala are on high alert for the latest in a series of outbreaks of the incurable Nipah virus.

item.title: Britain will soon lay out new plans to regulate 'buy now, pay later' firms like Klarna after delays
item.description: A U.K. Treasury department spokesperson said the government will set out plans to regulate "buy now, pay later" plans "shortly."

item.title: Nvidia supplier SK Hynix posts highest quarterly profit in 6 years on AI chip leadership
item.description: SK Hynix on Thursday said that a continuous rise in overall prices of its memory products led to a 32% increase in revenue compared with the previous quarter.

item.title: Now you can see Taylor Swift’s costumes, shoes and instruments at a top London museum — for free
item.description: Swift's costumes, and other objects from her archive, are being shown at a free "Songbook Trail" exhibition at London's V&A museum.

item.title: Biden says he put 'personal ambition' aside to 'pass the torch' to Harris for Trump battle
item.description: President Biden dropped out of the race against Donald Trump and endorsed Kamala Harris while isolating with Covid-19 in Delaware.

item.title: Chinese EV startups are spending more on research than Tesla is
item.description: U.S.-listed Chinese electric car companies are spending more on research as a ratio to sales than Tesla, according to CNBC analysis.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Wall Street sinks, Tesla slumps
item.description: S&P 500 and Nasdaq tumble for worst day since 2022. Tesla slumps 12%. Ford misses earnings

item.title: Tesla shares close down 12% after earnings miss for biggest slump since 2020
item.description: Tesla shares dropped after the company reported second-quarter earnings that missed expectations.

item.title: Salary transparency gains steam in Asia as young people share their salaries online
item.description: Whereas California and New York require companies to share pay ranges on job postings, most companies in Asia limit pay transparency to internal stakeholders.

item.title: Why an indicator that has foretold almost every recession doesn't seem to be working anymore
item.description: The situation has many on Wall Street scratching their heads about why the inverted curve has been so wrong this time

item.title: India 'clearly has a problem' finding new drivers for economic growth, JPMorgan's Jahangir Aziz says
item.description: India "clearly has a problem" figuring out new drivers for its economic growth even as its economy expands at a fast pace, JPMorgan said.

item.title: Major global chip equipment makers' China revenue share has doubled since U.S. imposed export controls
item.description: Four of the world's largest chip equipment manufacturers have more than doubled the share of their China revenue since late 2022, Bank of America analysts said.

item.title: Ford shares tumble 13% after massive earnings miss
item.description: The automaker increased its target for free cash flow but maintained its 2024 earnings guidance, disappointing some investors who had hoped for a hike.
